citation.abstract: Defining tumor from non-tumor tissue is one of the major challenges of cancer surgery. Surgeons depend on visual and tactile clues to select which tissues should be removed from a patient. Recently, we and others have hypothesized near-infrared (NIR) imaging can be used during surgery to differentiate tumors from normal tissue.
citation.title: Intraoperative Near-Infrared Imaging Can Distinguish Cancer from Normal Tissue but Not Inflammation

author.name: Oncologiavet
author.description: Francisco Alvarez Berger DVM MSc DACVIM (Oncology) - Veterinary oncology
